txt.en: You have attained glory against the Orcs
Preparations for the assault on Maustazg are now complete, which Ingmar has decided to lead himself, against his father's wishes.\n\n<rgb=#FF0000>NOTE: This instance can only be completed Solo.</rgb>

'The preparations for the attack on Maustazg are now complete, but alas... Ingmar has defied my commands and has taken command of the assault. Go to him at once and see that he does not do anything rash.

'I wish that I were joining you in this battle, but I cannot. My duty is first to my people, and I cannot leave them undefended, even to protect my son.

'You have my thanks for the assistance you have provided thus far, [placeholder]. May you win glory as well!'

<rgb=#FF0000>NOTE: This instance can only be completed Solo.</rgb>
Reeve Ingbert is in the Mead Hall of Eaworth.\n\nYou should speak with Ingbert if you are ready to join Ingmar for the assault on Maustazg.

'Alas that I could not join in the fray. Perhaps if I had, my son would not lie abed in the infirmary.

'Nevertheless, victory belongs to the house of Léotharn, and my son has earned the glory he so desired. His wounds will mend, and we will be the stronger for it!'

Ingbert looks grim as he continues.

'But all is not well. From what Ingmar reports and what you have told me, there is indeed a traitor in our midst with whom I am loath to pursue justice.'
Ingbert is in the Mead Hall of Eaworth.\n\nYou should speak with Ingbert regarding the assault on Maustazg.
Ingbert is in the Mead Hall of Eaworth.\n\nYou should speak with Ingbert regarding the assault on Maustazg.
'Ha! To battle then, and may the Orcs feel the wrath of the Mark!'\n\n<rgb=#FF0000>NOTE: This instance can only be completed Solo.</rgb>

'Alas that I could not join in the fray. Perhaps if I had, my son would not lie abed in the infirmary.

'Nevertheless, victory belongs to the house of Léotharn, and my son has earned the glory he so desired. His wounds will mend, and we will be the stronger for it!'

Ingbert looks grim as he continues.

'But all is not well. From what Ingmar reports and what you have told me, there is indeed a traitor in our midst with whom I am loath to pursue justice.'
Talk to Ingbert to accompany Ingmar to Maustazg
Talk to Ingbert in the Mead Hall of Eaworth
